summary_CylC.summary: In the study, they couldn't obtain CylC alone, they ended up using N-terminally His6-tagged CylC when coexpressed with CylA and NHis6-CylB in E. coli BAP1. They also found that CylB and CylC probably form a complex.

summary_NocO.summary: Has improved expression characteristics compared to CylC. They screened 12 phylogenetically diverse CylC homologues and this was the one choosen. Just like in AurF, mutating the metal-binding active site residues causes difficulties with expression. Using E.coli ArcticExpress (DE3), a BL21 derivative solved the issue. In this system Cpn60 and Cpn10 from Oleispira antarctica are constitutively expressed. NocM and NocL copurify with Cpn60 and Cpn10. NocO catalyzes highly chemo-and regioselective chlorination of the terminal carbon of an ACP-tethered dodecanoyl thioester. ,,Mssbauer spectrum of as-isolated NocO exhibits primarily quadrupole doublet features indicative of antiferromagnetically coupled diiron(III) clusters."

{"producer": "Amycolatopsis orientalis DSM40040",
"host": "Escherichia coli BL21(DE3)pLysS",
"reductase": "SsuE from E. coli added to aqueous buffer with free FAD and NADPH",
"halide-source": "NaCl",
"notest": "375 and 450 nm peak in UV-Vis spectrum, characteristic to flavoproteins; extended dialysis (Tris-HCl buffer, pH 7.5 did not lead to loss of yellow color)"}

{"producer": "Amycolatopsis orientalis NRRL 2452, solid and liquid cultures",
"halide source": "HCl and NaCl"}

summary_flA1.summary: Organism grown in shaking flask with 2 mM supplemented fluoride.

summary_flA2.summary: Grown in shaking-flask cultures with 2 mM fluoride in various media

summary_flA4.summary: 8.20+/-0.96 mM KF. Adenosine and 5'-FDA enhance protein stability and the wild-type enzyme is more stable than other mutants. Tris-HCl buffer (pH 7.0) is better for maintaining stability. Optimal temperature is 40 C. pH is crucial for activity, the enzyme seems to prefer acidic environment as low as 4. Addition of EDTA makes the enzyme less active. Cu and Zn inhibit activity. Excellent stability over 4 days in 25C in a 50 mM Tris-HCl buffer (pH 7.0).
summary_flA4.reference: Ma, L., Li, Y., Meng, L., Deng, H., Li, Y., Zhang, Q., & Diao, A. (2016). Biological fluorination from the sea: discovery of a SAM-dependent nucleophilic fluorinating enzyme from the marine-derived bacterium Streptomyces xinghaiensis NRRL B24674. RSC Advances, 6(32), 27047-27051.

summary_AmVBPO1.summary: MCD with 200 mM KCl or KBr

Bromocyclization of terpenes is the preferred reaction in Corallina VHPOs, but these substrates were not accepted regardless of the presence of organic co-solvents. Dicarbonyl compounds and activated arenes were accepted. 2xOMe and 3xOMe arenes were halogenated in a selective manner. Exposure to 100 mM H2O2 concentrations for 7 h led to a 90% decrease in activity. The inactivation was reversible upon H2O2 consumption. No significant difference in the halogenation activity was observed and it didn't matter whether the oxidant was added slowly or in one addition.

summary_LdVBPO1.summary: Sporophytes collected from the vicinity of Roscoff, kept under a 12:12 light-dark cycle in running seawater at 15C or immediately frozen and kept at -80C. Haloperoxidase activity was measured on non-denaturing gels, soaked with 100 mM potassium phosphate buffer, pH 7.4, 0.45 H2O2, 0.1 mMo-dianisidine, 10 mM potassium iodine, potassium bromide and potassium chloride.
